itemDescription: British military officer; Viscount in the Peerage of Ireland

wikipedia_page.main:
Brigadier Eric FitzGerald Dillon, 19th Viscount Dillon,  CMG, DSO (1881–1946) was an Irish peer and British Army officer who served in World War I.
He was educated at Rugby School and won the DSO, Legion of Honour, CMG, Croix de Guerre, Belgian Croix de Guerre and Order of Leopold of Belgian.  He was a member of the Travellers' Club and lived at 5 Embankment Gardens Chelsea, London SW3. He and his wife, Nora Juanita Muriel (née Beckett), had two children. Their son, Michael Eric Dillon, succeeded his father as the 20th Viscount Dillon. Their daughter, Pamela Dillon, married William Onslow, 6th Earl of Onslow.

response: Onslow was the only son of William Onslow, 6th Earl of Onslow and his first wife, Pamela Dillon, daughter of Eric Dillon, 19th Viscount Dillon.Michael William Coplestone Dillon Onslow, 7th Earl of Onslow profile at thepeerage.com He was educated at Eton and the Sorbonne.
On 4 August 1936, Onslow married the Hon. Pamela Louisa Eleanor Dillon, only daughter of Eric Dillon, 19th Viscount Dillon.  They had two children:

Charles Edward Beckett  was the son of Charles William Beckett of Thorne in Yorkshire, England. He married Louisa Michel, daughter of Field-Marshal Sir John Michel of Dewlish. They had one daughter Nora Juanita Muriel Beckett, who married Eric Dillon, 19th Viscount Dillon. Beckett married for the second time in July 1915, at Westminster Cathedral to Mary Philippa, of Culachy, Fort Augustus, Scotland.

Pamela Louisa Eleanor Onslow, Countess of Onslow (née Hon. Pamela Louisa Eleanor Dillon; 26 August 1915 – 14 April 1992)  was an English socialite. She was born in Dorchester, Dorset, the daughter of Eric Dillon, 19th Viscount Dillon. She married the 6th Earl of Onslow on 4 August 1936, several weeks before her 21st birthday. The marriage was dissolved by divorce in 1962.
